tool.name: FASTA ID Swapper
tool.description: Reorders header line with strain/name from ending parentheticals

param.label: Space Separator
param.name: space
param.help: Select 'last' or the numbered word to be placed at the front of header.

tool.help:
**What it does**
* This tool is to aid in clarifying the phage being examined for CLC as it uses the first uninterrupted string as the record name. * More options can be added to this if the need arises. * Selection for either parentheses or square bracket wrappers. * Word based on space separators or the last one in the header. * It takes the value from the above two points and appends it to the beginning of the header.
INPUT : FASTA file (single or multi)
METHOD : FASTA sequence where the strain/name at the end of the fasta header line is inserted at the beginning of the header.
OUTPUT : Swapped ID FASTA file.
EXAMPLE :
>YP_004539126.1 hypothetical protein LIMEzero_ORF53 [Pantoea phage LIMEzero]
* If you wanted LIMEzero to be the first word in the header: * Select "Square Brackets, [ and ]" and type "last" (no quotes) * If you wanted LIMEzero_ORF53 you would select "Square Brackets, [ and ]" and "4" (no quotes) * Keep in mind that this scheme is dependent on if you are choosing a different word than 'last', the spacing of data and information is homogenous across the headers in the multifasta. This is not necessarily true.
